paragraph: John, a successful businessman, inspired many with his vivid visions of a better society. He said that discipline and a courageous spirit were essential to achieving greatness. As he shared his plan, people began to think about their own potential. Comforted by his words, they decided to study hard and contribute to a brighter future.

vivid.pronunciationTip: You're pronouncing 'v' like 'w', which is wrong. To pronounce the 'v' sound clearly, try putting your upper teeth on your lower lip.
sentences: The sunset painted a vivid picture of orange and pink across the sky.
She described her dream with such vivid detail that it felt like I was there.
After years of hard work and dedication, he finally achieved his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur.
The team's successful strategy led them to victory in the championship game.
Her speech inspired the audience to take action and make a difference.
The artist was inspired by the beauty of nature and incorporated it into his paintings.
I think it's going to rain today, so don't forget your umbrella.
If you think about it, the solution to the problem is quite simple.
He said he would be here at 5 o'clock.
She said she loves chocolate ice cream.

comforted.mistakeType: Placing stress on the wrong syllable

paragraph: Samantha enjoyed visiting various cafés around the world. In her private time, she would really immerse herself in the process of tasting different lattes. paragraph: Robert, an excellent pilot, visited small islands where he would often develop friendships with the kind locals.
